snippet: Calling the breakout “humiliating,” Afghan officials said someone had altered an official document that let at least 10 prisoners walk out the front gate of a prison in Kandahar in broad daylight.
abstract: Taliban insurgents escape from heavily guarded Sarposa Prison in Kandahar, fourth such prison break in decade; latest incident is smaller in scale than past episodes, but escapees are thought to be among most prominent insurgents being held at prison.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Calling the breakout “humiliating,” Afghan officials said someone had altered an official document that let at least 10 prisoners walk out the front gate of a prison in Kandahar in broad daylight.

headline.main: Altered Letter Fools Afghans and 10 Flee From Prison
